website_summaries.verdict: Delivers a good value with a reasonable price per foot, as well as the hardware you need to install it.
pros: Offered in multiple lengths up to 200 feet
Installation is an easy process on most styles of roofs, gutters, and downspouts
Considering its price point, the quality of the materials in the heat cable is better than you may expect
cons: Doesn't work well in extremely cold temperatures
May not last more than a couple of years

customer_reviews.title: I did not run these like recommended along the roof in a up and down ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these to deice gutters and downspouts this winter and the result is phenomenal! No more frozen downspouts and even melts the snow in and around the gutters. I did not run these like recommended along the roof in a up and down pattern, I just put them in the gutters and ran into the downspouts to the outlets. They are permanently installed and all I need to do is plug them in when it snows. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: Stay Away! Bought this due to the good reviews and boy did I make a mistake. Worked fine for one season and that was it. I just tried plugging it in to get ready for the cold weather and it's tripping my GFIC. Tried another extension cord and the same thing. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: jill herring

customer_reviews.title: As far as I can tell, it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Near as I can tell, it doesn't work. No evidence of melted snow where the wire runs. The snow is even across where the wire is and isn't. Unfortunately due to the way this product is installed/used by the time I got snow and discovered it was not melting, the return period is expired.
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: using them for years
customer_reviews.text: We live in the northeast and have a flat roof -- a horrible combination. When our gutters freeze up, the water on the roof (which has a parapit wall around it) has no place to go. Eventually it freezes but the ice closest to the warmer house melts during the day and voila, we have an indoor waterfall!!! We put this deicing kit up and down the gutter and around the opening and have had no problems -- except when my son accidentally cut the wire!! Def recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: joycefl6

customer_reviews.title: Was listed as a new item however the item I ...
customer_reviews.text: Was listed as a new item however the item I received was clearly opened, damaged ( hopefully just cosmetic) and then the box was poorly taped back together. I'll update the review if the damages turn out to be more than cosmetic.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomerWithaName

customer_reviews.title: Just in the nick of time
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for saving our roof. We are having the worst winter ever and everyones roof is suffering with ice dams. I ordered these and they have been up 4 days....our ice dams are history and our downspouts are flowing. We are telling everyone about this great product. Thawing in Idaho!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Heat de-icing heat cables do the job!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Easy Heat De-Icing cable that I've purchased (using this one to keep a drain ice-free). Previous cables have worked well in maintaining a even warm temperature that keeps a ice free channel for water to properly drain.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I put it in my gutters works well reading how a lot of people are popping gfi .If you are using an extension cord that could be why.I had another that use to do that but if it was hard lined it was fine . So I put in outlets wherever I plug in haven't had any problems in 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Ro

customer_reviews.title: Good, reasonably priced product, but wrong size ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I liked it, but unfortunately I had to return it, because I needed 60 feet. Make sure you measure your roof line, before committing. I was only a couple of feet off, but from what I've read, there is no way to connect two. The refund process was easy and quick, though.
customer_reviews.author: TheHappyOne613

customer_reviews.title: Wow! a product with a great instruction manual.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Easy to install. For once a product with a thorough and well written instruction manual. Seems to be working well. Hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: David Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Power-Hungry
customer_reviews.text: We have had two of these on our house, for several years. They have completely eliminated the ice dams and clogged downspouts that used to trouble us. It has been exceptionally snowy, and cold this winter, and the cables have still done the job. One thing to keep in mind is the power consumption. At 5 watts per foot, 50 feet of cable uses 6 kWh per day, or 180 kWh per month. At 20 cents per kWh, that costs $36 per month. To reduce that cost, I've started unplugging the cables when the roof was clear of snow. The reviews on the optional automatic control have been mixed, but I may give that a try, next season.
customer_reviews.author: TervFan

customer_reviews.title: Works decently
customer_reviews.text: We ran this through our gutter because our gutter always freezes and then ice covers our porch. This does provide one or two lines of water instead of solid ice, but it did not fix the problem. It helps a bunch compared to how it used to be, but it doesn't warm enough to melt much ice (or in our case, it doesn't keep a whole lot of water from freezing).
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: but it sure looks like it will do fine
customer_reviews.text: Have not installed it yet, but it sure looks like it will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install in Gutter and Downspout
customer_reviews.text: Using for short gutter section (under gutter protection microscreen) and one downspout, double run in each, easy to install, heats up quickly -- but awaiting winter to see how it melts the ice.
customer_reviews.author: saltedcaramel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: seems to do the job, although we didnt have a very severe winter last season, well see next winter!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Melting Jack Frost
customer_reviews.text: Great Price! Fast Shipping! Came in just the nick of time. Looking forward to this helping to keep the ice drift from building up.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: The unit seemed fine, I made the mistake of putting it in ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit seemed fine, I made the mistake of putting it in my gutter before I plugged it in. It blows the GFI outlet whenever it is plugged in, so I had to return it. I would recommend plugging it in to see if it is defective before you go to the trouble of running it on your roof. The unit looked to be of good quality, so maybe I just was unlucky.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: We were having a problem with a roof leak from ice dams on 1 of our box gutters. The product worked great. After it was installed, we had no leaks through the winter even with the heavy snows and cold this year.
customer_reviews.author: Michael (or Sharon)

customer_reviews.title: all fine
customer_reviews.text: have used many product from this company, all fine items
customer_reviews.author: RadioRob

customer_reviews.title: Easy and do the job well
customer_reviews.text: Used these de-icing cables for years. Durable. Easy to instal. Melt the snow and ice away with ease. Remember to route a ground wire for your gutters and down spouts for safety.
customer_reviews.author: FlagJC

customer_reviews.title: I will have no damage to my roof this year ...
customer_reviews.text: I will have no damage to my roof this year because I put these wires on my roof to melt the snow and ice. No ice dams this year.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Hear's hoping.
customer_reviews.text: Using this in an outdoor culvert that keeps freezing due to a very warm Alaska winter. Hopefully come spring, it will work :)
customer_reviews.author: p'moto

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work as intended. I got bought this deicing heat tape and put it on roof. But this take does not work. IT feels cold on touch. It is buried under snow/ice on roof and gutter. This does not heat at all. I tested my electrical outlet and connector cable but these are working fine. Hear tape is bad. I can't return since to take out cable I will have to remove all ice which may damage shingles and gutter. I am stuck with faulty product on roof and still have to remove snow everytime there is snow storm. I spent money to have someone install this on roof.
customer_reviews.author: Deepa Ajmire

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It really keeps my drains open in a bad snow storm
customer_reviews.author: Key West Bare

customer_reviews.title: haven't had to use yet
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use this yet, but I wanted to give a word of advice: I was told to buy double the length of the area you want covered. Not even close. I had a 17-foot length of roof that faces north. I purchased a 30-foot length and it barely made it halfway across hooking it up the way the instructions say to do it. I'll probably just buy a longer one at some point and use this one somewhere else. As long as it melts the ice I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tron Carter

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Advice is buy more feet than you think you need
customer_reviews.author: Randy Gnaedinger

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Smart purchase. We use it to heat the drainage system out of the eave spots and garage.
customer_reviews.author: SweetPea

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: installing it in a couple of weeks .. great price
customer_reviews.author: DAVID TOZER

customer_reviews.title: Know how much to get before you buy
customer_reviews.text: The rope works just fine. I've been able to keep my gutters clear all winter. Compare that to last year when I had water backing up into the roof and buying this kit was worth every penny! One warning, I didn't buy enough rope to zig-zag across the lower part of my roof. Do your research and know how much rope you will need before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked for less than a year. Blows fuses. Cant get a replacement from the manufacturer or amazon. Very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Bowie Mills

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased in the past a competitors product in a big box store that ignited when I first plugged it in. This one worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bond

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This product line is always a great value offering excellent performance and years of durability.
customer_reviews.author: Marlowe Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-duty, should last a long time
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed by the quality of the cable insulation and the cord. Should survive a long time in outdoor exposure. 5 watts / foot is adequate power density for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's just the right length and very good quality for my de-icing.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install , works great . They need to make the plug/cord end just a bit longer . You will still need a heavy short cord to plug in .
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Jahr

customer_reviews.title: Warmed my winter boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to warm my snow boots. They are easy to insert into boot, with nice long electrical wire, but really would have liked them to get a little hotter. I had no fear that my boots would burst into flames! I also bought them to dry out my gardening boots next spring, and I think they will do a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S.

customer_reviews.title: great item Easy Heat Kit
customer_reviews.text: mine came quickly and i am quite satisfied with my Easy Heat i would highly reccomed this item for anyone thank you Bob
customer_reviews.author: Joan Adis

customer_reviews.title: Not capable of melting snow and ice very disappointing since ...
customer_reviews.text: Not capable of melting snow and ice very disappointing since I installed myself which isn't difficult but after getting up on my roof and making the effort I expected it to work costing me time and money would have purchased a larger gauge tape if available would send it back but too late I have a mess
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth huegli

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install.. Will attest after 1st snow or ice as effective or not
customer_reviews.author: Gene Oberjohann

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Warranty
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer never responded to my letter stating that the product did not work. They only provide an address and my letter was ignored.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan F.

customer_reviews.title: it was working fine. plugged it in afterwards and keeps tripping the ...
customer_reviews.text: checked this unit before i installed it. it was working fine. plugged it in afterwards and keeps tripping the gfi circuit. luckily the return policy was still in effect.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Transaction and great low price for this de-icing cord for my rain gutters.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming Buck

customer_reviews.title: The item was faulty, clearly this issue was not ...
customer_reviews.text: The item was faulty, clearly this issue was not discovered until the itm was installed...then the electrician needed to install a new one. $$$
customer_reviews.author: Liz W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Heat review
customer_reviews.text: Product relatively easy to install. Does not seem to deteriorate over # of years. Heat is enough to melt through snow and ice no matter how heavy within 6 hours. Very effective for preventing gutter freeze ups resulting in roof damage. Have been using for 15+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Bigger

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: used last winter and it worked great but I just plugged it in and it is shorted out,piece of junk, for the price I paid it should have lasted years!
customer_reviews.author: fitter

product_meta.title: Easy Heat ADKS-150 30-Foot Roof Snow De-Icing Kit
product_meta.description:
Roof/gutter kit 30'

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
It's not those big icicles that do the real damage, it's the ice you don't see that backs up in gutters and under shingles. When the ice melts it can really do a number on repair costs. Easy Heat ADKS roof de-icing cable prevents this water and ice damage by providing a clear path for melting water to flow off the roof. The versatile design adapts to most roof and gutter configurations. This product is intended for the sole use of preventing ice dams from forming on inclined roofs with tab shingles, in gutters and downspouts. This roof de-icing cable is not intended for use as a snow melting system to clear roof of ice and snow. This system can be installed with confidence that it will operate for years without requiring service. All components are made of the highest quality material and are tested during critical points in the manufacturing process.
feature_bullets: Snow de-icing cable prevents winter damage to roof, gutters, and downspouts
Provides uninterrupted path for melting water to flow off roof
Suitable for most roof and gutter configurations; available in several lengths
Easy to install; no maintenance required

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
